intro: Disperis lantauensis, commonly known as Lantau Disperis, is a rare flowering plant native to Hong Kong. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, such as along stream banks or in rocky crevices. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, white or pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
